resources.string: "Thanks for signing up to protect yourself and your community."
"Together we can slow the spread of COVID-19"

"If you choose to register with the SA COVID-19 Tracer app, your personal information will only be used by the University and out public health system for the purposes of the COVID-19 pandemic response, such as contact tracing "
"Which is why if you have tested positive for coronavirus (or suspect you may have been exposed to it), you owe it to your loved ones to notify them about their potential exposure to COVID-19"

During this time, you may be looking for ways to help you and your community get through
Staying active and fit is difficult during lockdown. Exercise is important to boost your immune system and reduce stress

If you are feeling unwell or unsafe, get help and support form these numbers

"You will be at risk if you checked in at a location that had a positive visit on the same day.\nPay attention to possible signs of illness.\nIf you start experiencing symptoms of COVID-19, then you must get tested as soon as possible."
All of us in South Africa are facing the challenges of COVID-19 together.
What is the purpose for the SA Covid Tracer app?

If you choose to register with the SA COVID-19 Tracer app, your personal information will only be used by the University and our public health system for the purposes of the COVID-19 pandemic response, such as contact tracing.

Any information you share with the University via the SA COVID Tracer app will not be shared with other Government agencies unless they are directly involved in assisting with the public health response to COVID-19. It will not be enforcement purposes.
How long will my information be kept?

Information you enter about yourself including, will be stored for the duration of the COVID-19 pandemic response, then it will be deleted. The only exception will be if the information has become part of your personal health record if you have COVID-19 or a potential close contact, in which information will be held as part of your health record after the pandemic response has ended.
Who can I contact if I have a privacy concern?

If you are not satisfied with our response to any privacy-related concern you may have, you can contact the Deputy Head of Computer Science and Applied Mathematics
Dr Hima Vadapalli Email: hima.vadapalli@wits.ac.za Tel: (27) (0) 11 717 6186

Information collected for statistical purposes will not be linked to the personal information you provide or the profile you create. We may collect statistical information to help us improve the service, and understand how it is being used. This information is aggregated and does not identify you personally.
